Title: Filtering Results - Basics
DescriptionLines: **Filter the documents** by specifying some conditions on the **document fields** properties
Only the matching documents will be returned by the server.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query on the 'Employees' collection Using the Session `query()` method.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a filtering condition
DescriptionLines: * This example queries for documents from the _Employees_ collection that match the following criteria:

* The queried document field ('FirstName') is _case-sensitive_ -
use the exact same casing as inside your document.
* More filtering options are available - see related links.
* Since no index is specified within the query, RavenDB will create a matching Auto-Index if there is no existing Auto-Index that can answer this query.
* The index-fields that will be created in the Auto-Index depend on the filtering method used:
The index-field created will contain terms with an exact match to the queried document-field.
* One with an exact match same as the above

* One with tokenized terms.
The document-field content is tokenized by RavenDB's default analyzer.
* If your text needs to be tokenized with a different analyzer, then you need to use a static index instead of a dynamic query.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: * The 'filtered_query' variable only stores the query definition.
* The 'filtered_employees' variable will hold the resulting matching document entities.
* The entities returned by the query are _'loaded'_ to the session.
